ALEPH. Blessed <FI>are<Fi> the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the LORD.<RF>undefiled: or, perfect, or, sincere<Rf>
Blessed <FI>are<Fi> they that keep his testimonies, <FI>and that<Fi> seek him with the whole heart.
They also do no iniquity: they walk in his ways.<CM>
Thou hast commanded <FI>us<Fi> to keep thy precepts diligently.
O that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
Then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.<CM>
I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.<RF>thy…: Heb. judgments of thy righteousness<Rf>
I will keep thy statutes: O forsake me not utterly.<CM>
BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? by taking heed <FI>thereto<Fi> according to thy word.<CM>
With my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander from thy commandments.<CM>
Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.<CM>
Blessed <FI>art<Fi> thou, O LORD: teach me thy statutes.<CM>
With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies, as <FI>much as<Fi> in all riches.
I will meditate in thy precepts, and have respect unto thy ways.
I will delight myself in thy statutes: I will not forget thy word.<CM>
GIMEL. Deal bountifully with thy servant, <FI>that<Fi> I may live, and keep thy word.<CM>
Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of thy law.<RF>Open: Heb. Reveal<Rf><CM>
I <FI>am<Fi> a stranger in the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.<CM>
My soul breaketh for the longing <FI>that it hath<Fi> unto thy judgments at all times.<CM>
Thou hast rebuked the proud <FI>that are<Fi> cursed, which do err from thy commandments.<CM>
Remove from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy testimonies.<CM>
Princes also did sit <FI>and<Fi> speak against me: <FI>but<Fi> thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.<CM>
Thy testimonies also <FI>are<Fi> my delight <FI>and<Fi> my counsellors.<RF>my counsellors: Heb. men of my counsel<Rf><CM>
DALETH. My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me according to thy word.<CM>
I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.<CM>
My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.<RF>melteth: Heb. droppeth<Rf>
Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.<CM>
I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments have I laid <FI>before me<Fi>.
I have stuck unto thy testimonies: O LORD, put me not to shame.
I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou shalt enlarge my heart.<CM>
HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes; and I shall keep it <FI>unto<Fi> the end.
Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law; yea, I shall observe it with <FI>my<Fi> whole heart.<CM>
Make me to go in the path of thy commandments; for therein do I delight.
Incline my heart unto thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.<CM>
Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity; <FI>and<Fi> quicken thou me in thy way.<RF>Turn…: Heb. Make to pass<Rf><CM>
Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who <FI>is devoted<Fi> to thy fear.<CM>
Turn away my reproach which I fear: for thy judgments <FI>are<Fi> good.<CM>
Behold, I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy righteousness.<CM>
VAU. Let thy mercies come also unto me, O LORD, <FI>even<Fi> thy salvation, according to thy word.
So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.<RF>So…: or, So shall I answer him that reproveth me in a thing<Rf><CM>
And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in thy judgments.
So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.<CM>
And I will walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.<RF>at liberty: Heb. at large<Rf>
I will speak of thy testimonies also before kings, and will not be ashamed.
And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in thy statutes.<CM>
ZAIN. Remember the word unto thy servant, upon which thou hast caused me to hope.<CM>
This <FI>is<Fi> my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.<CM>
The proud have had me greatly in derision: <FI>yet<Fi> have I not declined from thy law.<CM>
I remembered thy judgments of old, O LORD; and have comforted myself.<CM>
Horror hath taken hold upon me because of the wicked that forsake thy law.<CM>
Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.<CM>
I have remembered thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have kept thy law.
This I had, because I kept thy precepts.<CM>
CHETH. <FI>Thou art<Fi> my portion, O LORD: I have said that I would keep thy words.<CM>
I intreated thy favour with <FI>my<Fi> whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.<RF>favour: Heb. face<Rf><CM>
I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.
I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.<CM>
The bands of the wicked have robbed me: <FI>but<Fi> I have not forgotten thy law.<RF>bands: or, companies<Rf><CM>
At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee because of thy righteous judgments.<CM>
I <FI>am<Fi> a companion of all <FI>them<Fi> that fear thee, and of them that keep thy precepts.<CM>
The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy statutes.<CM>
TETH. Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O LORD, according unto thy word.
Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.<CM>
Before I was afflicted I went astray: but now have I kept thy word.<CM>
Thou <FI>art<Fi> good, and doest good; teach me thy statutes.<CM>
The proud have forged a lie against me: <FI>but<Fi> I will keep thy precepts with <FI>my<Fi> whole heart.
Their heart is as fat as grease; <FI>but<Fi> I delight in thy law.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.<CM>
The law of thy mouth <FI>is<Fi> better unto me than thousands of gold and silver.<CM>
JOD. Thy hands have made me and fashioned me: give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.<CM>
They that fear thee will be glad when they see me; because I have hoped in thy word.<CM>
I know, O LORD, that thy judgments <FI>are<Fi> right, and <FI>that<Fi> thou in faithfulness hast afflicted me.<RF>right: Heb. righteousness<Rf><CM>
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.<RF>for…: Heb. to comfort me<Rf>
Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live: for thy law <FI>is<Fi> my delight.<CM>
Let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt perversely with me without a cause: <FI>but<Fi> I will meditate in thy precepts.
Let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have known thy testimonies.<CM>
Let my heart be sound in thy statutes; that I be not ashamed.<CM>
CAPH. My soul fainteth for thy salvation: <FI>but<Fi> I hope in thy word.
Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?<CM>
For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; <FI>yet<Fi> do I not forget thy statutes.<CM>
How many <FI>are<Fi> the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?<CM>
The proud have digged pits for me, which <FI>are<Fi> not after thy law.
All thy commandments <FI>are<Fi> faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.<RF>faithful: Heb. faithfulness<Rf>
They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.<CM>
Quicken me after thy lovingkindness; so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.<CM>
LAMED. For ever, O LORD, thy word is settled in heaven.
Thy faithfulness <FI>is<Fi> unto all generations: thou hast established the earth, and it abideth.<RF>unto…: Heb. to generation and generation<Rf><RF>abideth: Heb. standeth<Rf>
They continue this day according to thine ordinances: for all <FI>are<Fi> thy servants.<CM>
Unless thy law <FI>had been<Fi> my delights, I should then have perished in mine affliction.<CM>
I will never forget thy precepts: for with them thou hast quickened me.<CM>
I <FI>am<Fi> thine, save me; for I have sought thy precepts.<CM>
The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: <FI>but<Fi> I will consider thy testimonies.<CM>
I have seen an end of all perfection: <FI>but<Fi> thy commandment <FI>is<Fi> exceeding broad.<CM>
MEM. O how love I thy law! it <FI>is<Fi> my meditation all the day.<CM>
Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they <FI>are<Fi> ever with me.<RF>they…: Heb. it is ever with me<Rf>
I have more understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies <FI>are<Fi> my meditation.
I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.<CM>
I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.<CM>
I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.<CM>
How sweet are thy words unto my taste! <FI>yea, sweeter<Fi> than honey to my mouth!<RF>taste: Heb. palate<Rf>
Through thy precepts I get understanding: therefore I hate every false way.<CM>
NUN. Thy word <FI>is<Fi> a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.<RF>lamp: or, candle<Rf><CM>
I have sworn, and I will perform <FI>it<Fi>, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.<CM>
I am afflicted very much: quicken me, O LORD, according unto thy word.<CM>
Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me thy judgments.<CM>
My soul <FI>is<Fi> continually in my hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
The wicked have laid a snare for me: yet I erred not from thy precepts.<CM>
Thy testimonies have I taken as an heritage for ever: for they <FI>are<Fi> the rejoicing of my heart.
I have inclined mine heart to perform thy statutes alway, <FI>even unto<Fi> the end.<RF>to perform: Heb. to do<Rf><CM>
SAMECH. I hate <FI>vain<Fi> thoughts: but thy law do I love.<CM>
Thou <FI>art<Fi> my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.<CM>
Depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments of my God.<CM>
Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect unto thy statutes continually.<CM>
Thou hast trodden down all them that err from thy statutes: for their deceit <FI>is<Fi> falsehood.
Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth <FI>like<Fi> dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.<RF>puttest…: Heb. causest to cease<Rf>
My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.<CM>
AIN. I have done judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressors.
Be surety for thy servant for good: let not the proud oppress me.<CM>
Mine eyes fail for thy salvation, and for the word of thy righteousness.<CM>
Deal with thy servant according unto thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
I <FI>am<Fi> thy servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> time for <FI>thee<Fi>, LORD, to work: <FI>for<Fi> they have made void thy law.<CM>
Therefore I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold.
Therefore I esteem all <FI>thy<Fi> precepts <FI>concerning<Fi> all <FI>things to be<Fi> right; <FI>and<Fi> I hate every false way.<CM>
PE. Thy testimonies <FI>are<Fi> wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.<CM>
The entrance of thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.<CM>
I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.<CM>
Look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy name.<RF>as thou…: Heb. according to the custom toward those, etc<Rf><CM>
Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.<CM>
Deliver me from the oppression of man: so will I keep thy precepts.<CM>
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; and teach me thy statutes.<CM>
Rivers of waters run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.<CM>
TZADDI. Righteous <FI>art<Fi> thou, O LORD, and upright <FI>are<Fi> thy judgments.
Thy testimonies <FI>that<Fi> thou hast commanded <FI>are<Fi> righteous and very faithful.<RF>righteous: Heb. righteousness<Rf><RF>faithful: Heb. faithfulness<Rf><CM>
My zeal hath consumed me, because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.<RF>consumed…: Heb. cut me off<Rf><CM>
Thy word <FI>is<Fi> very pure: therefore thy servant loveth it.<RF>pure: Heb. tried, or, refined<Rf><CM>
I <FI>am<Fi> small and despised: <FI>yet<Fi> do not I forget thy precepts.<CM>
Thy righteousness <FI>is<Fi> an everlasting righteousness, and thy law <FI>is<Fi> the truth.<CM>
Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me: <FI>yet<Fi> thy commandments <FI>are<Fi> my delights.<RF>taken…: Heb. found me<Rf>
The righteousness of thy testimonies <FI>is<Fi> everlasting: give me understanding, and I shall live.<CM>
KOPH. I cried with <FI>my<Fi> whole heart; hear me, O LORD: I will keep thy statutes.
I cried unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.<RF>and I…: or, that I may keep<Rf><CM>
I prevented the dawning of the morning, and cried: I hoped in thy word.
Mine eyes prevent the <FI>night<Fi> watches, that I might meditate in thy word.<CM>
Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O LORD, quicken me according to thy judgment.<CM>
They draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from thy law.
Thou <FI>art<Fi> near, O LORD; and all thy commandments <FI>are<Fi> truth.<CM>
Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.<CM>
RESH. Consider mine affliction, and deliver me: for I do not forget thy law.
Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.<CM>
Salvation <FI>is<Fi> far from the wicked: for they seek not thy statutes.<CM>
Great <FI>are<Fi> thy tender mercies, O LORD: quicken me according to thy judgments.<RF>Great: or, Many<Rf><CM>
Many <FI>are<Fi> my persecutors and mine enemies; <FI>yet<Fi> do I not decline from thy testimonies.<CM>
I beheld the transgressors, and was grieved; because they kept not thy word.<CM>
Consider how I love thy precepts: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy lovingkindness.<CM>
Thy word <FI>is<Fi> true <FI>from<Fi> the beginning: and every one of thy righteous judgments <FI>endureth<Fi> for ever.<RF>Thy word…: Heb. The beginning of thy word is true<Rf><CM>
SCHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.<CM>
I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.<CM>
I hate and abhor lying: <FI>but<Fi> thy law do I love.<CM>
Seven times a day do I praise thee because of thy righteous judgments.<CM>
Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.<RF>nothing…: Heb. they shall have no stumblingblock<Rf><CM>
LORD, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.<CM>
My soul hath kept thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.
I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: for all my ways <FI>are<Fi> before thee.<CM>
TAU. Let my cry come near before thee, O LORD: give me understanding according to thy word.
Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.<CM>
My lips shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy statutes.<CM>
My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments <FI>are<Fi> righteousness.<CM>
Let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thy precepts.
I have longed for thy salvation, O LORD; and thy law <FI>is<Fi> my delight.<CM>
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.<CM>
I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant; for I do not forget thy commandments.<CM>
